column5: Not sure how to embed it but this is worth watching.  http://video.ca.msn.com/?mkt=en-ca&vid=f1bb7c9b-1b63-4a9f-b216-f79bbc8df559&from=sharepermalink&src=v5:share:sharepermalink:
I'm somewhat hair challenged lol. He must shampoo with Gulp.
Ahahah, that was awesome. But I can't help it, I'm pretty sure that's a pumpkinseed... not a bass.
Looks like a bass to me?
lol, definitely bass, too long for sunfish.
watching it a second time I actually think it's a bluegill
Yeah, I full-screened it and paused when it was broadside to the camera... Definitely looks like a bluegill, got that nice dark spot on the gill plates.
Sunfish/blue gill. Correct.  Thats was so cool to watch. Young lads having fun.
It looks like a bluegill to me. Should try that on a girl with longer hair next time and watch her catch a pike on it. LOL
now cast that kid out there and wait for something big to hit the bluegill
o.k. I thought it was a bass, but agree it is a pan fish.
They were having too much fun for that to be legal. Next up, hair fishing equals one rod lol
Man, those guys got so excited when it actually worked.  I wonder how long that guy sat there with his head hanging over the side of the boat?

I can top that one, I think. While stream fishing for speckles just north of Sturgeon Falls a few years ago. lost my last Mepps on a snag. Heading back to the canoe found an old campfire with some tin foil left behind. Wrapped the tin foil, along with two split shot, around the shank of two hooks, a few casts later, a two lb spec. and lost my foil. No one believed me when I got back to camp, but.....true story.
It's a bluegill...    Pause it after he takes it out of the water, you can see the black spot on the gill plate.
Just goes to show how easy bass (sunfish) are to catch  try getting a real fish, with teeth, to do that! Lol  S
HAHAHAHAHAHA!!! Shampoo with gulp.......... Now that's FUNNY!
